net.wstech2.me.httpsclient

Class HttpsConnectionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.wstech2.me.httpsclient.HttpsConnectionImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.microedition.io.Connection, javax.microedition.io.ContentConnection, javax.microedition.io.HttpConnection, javax.microedition.io.HttpsConnection, javax.microedition.io.InputConnection, javax.microedition.io.OutputConnection, javax.microedition.io.StreamConnection

    public class HttpsConnectionImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.microedition.io.HttpsConnection
    HttpsConnectionImpl is an alternative implementation for the HttpsConnection interface. A few additional parameters are available to manage implementation specific details. See isAllowUntrustedCertificates() and getCertificate().

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpsConnectionImpl

        public HttpsConnectionImpl(java.lang.String host)
        Creates a HttpsConnectionImpl instance to handle a https connection. The following default values are assigned to the Port and Path attributes:
        port: 443
        path: "/"
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname.

      • HttpsConnectionImpl

        public HttpsConnectionImpl(java.lang.String host,
                   int port)
        Creates a HttpsConnectionImpl instance to handle a https connection. The following default value is assigned to the Path attribute:
        path: "/"
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname.
        port - Server TCP port.

      • HttpsConnectionImpl

        public HttpsConnectionImpl(java.lang.String host,
                   int port,
                   java.lang.String path)
        Creates a HttpsConnectionImpl instance to handle a https connection. The following default value is assigned to the Path attribute:
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname.
        port - Server TCP port.
        path - URL Path.

      • isAllowUntrustedCertificates

        public boolean isAllowUntrustedCertificates()
        Controls whether untrusted certificates are allowed for this connection or not. If this attribute is true then a connection will continue even when:
        - The server certificate could not be validated against a valid C.A. certificate because no C.A. certificate was provided;
        - The certificate is already expired or is not yet valid;
        - The certificate common name does not match the server host name.
        Returns:
        true if untrusted certificates are allowed or false otherwise.

      • setAllowUntrustedCertificates

        public void setAllowUntrustedCertificates(boolean allowUntrustedCertificates)
        See isAllowUntrustedCertificates().
        Parameters:
        allowUntrustedCertificates - true if untrusted certificates are allowed or false otherwise.

      • getCertificate

        public org.bouncycastle.crypto.tls.Certificate getCertificate()
        Return the certificate associated with this connect.
        Returns:
        The server certificate.

      • setCertificate

        public void setCertificate(org.bouncycastle.crypto.tls.Certificate serverCertificate)
        See getCertificate().
        Parameters:
        serverCertificate - The certificate associated with this connect.
